block.p: WILLIAMS COS., -- Tulsa, Okla., a natural gas pipeline company that is building a 33,000-mile fiber optic network, said it would join Invensys, London, a maker of factory controls, in a venture that would provide communications and energy management systems to institutions and businesses.

WILLIAMS COS., -- Tulsa, Okla., a natural gas pipeline company that is building a 33,000-mile fiber optic network, said it would join Invensys, London, a maker of factory controls, in a venture that would provide communications and energy management systems to institutions and businesses.

IVAX, -- Miami, a pharmaceutical holding company, said it had agreed to acquire Laboratorios Fustery, Mexico, which makes and markets prescription pharmaceuticals, for an undisclosed amount of cash and stock.

LODGIAN, -- Atlanta, a hotel owner and manager, said that it had received a buyout offer for about $126 million in cash from Whitehall Street Real Estate Limited Partnership XIII, a real estate investment fund, and Whitehall Parallel Real Estate Limited Partnership XIII. Under the proposal, Whitehall would acquire Lodgian's roughly 28.1 million outstanding shares for $4.50 each.
